data.title: Assimilating America: The Life and Stories of Isaac Bashevis Singer
data.meta_site_name: The National Endowment for the Humanities
data.text: "Assimilating America: The Life and Stories of Isaac Bashevis Singer," was funded by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH), which organized, presented, and supported public programs on the life and work of the Nobel Prize-winning Isaac Bashevis Singer (1904-1991). 50 public, academic, school, or special libraries participated in organizing Singer programs for the public.
